result.execSummary:
The defendant David nmi Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David nmi Martinez is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David nmi Martinez was found guilty of Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • David nmi Martinez was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to Ct.1 in file 14CF646.  Credit for 2 days served if revoked.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*  Pay costs of legal representation or Advocate Counsel fees for the defense of the case, to be determined within 60 days.
May not have contact with individuals who use or traffic in controlled substances.

records.addlTxt:
Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Lynn Bureta.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  Counts 1 and 4 - Sentence is withheld; Deft. placed on probation for 1 year with conditions Consecutive to Count 1 in 14CF646. Credit for 2 days if revoked.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning and Voting Acknowledgement given.

Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Lynn Bureta.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Counts 2, 3, and 5 - Dismissed on State motion.  Counts 1 and 4 - Pleas of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 11/6/14 at 2:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Angelina Gabriele appeared for the State. Attorney Lynn M. Bureta appeared on behalf of the defendant who is in custody and appearance is waived.  Clerk: PT
Atty Bureta states she received a counter offer from ADA Graveley and needs time to go over the new offer with the defendant.  FPT adj. to 10/2/14 at 1:15 P.
Deft's copy of Notice re: FPT on 9/12/14 returned by the USPS; Moved - Left No Address, Unable to Forward
Final pre-trial on September 12, 2014 at 09:50 am.

Def. waives time limits. Time limits tolled at request of def. Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 6-20-14 @ 9:30am. Bond continued.
